alert.note: Alert for Howard; Little River; Sevier (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 7:20PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Little River, southeastern Sevier, southeastern Howard and central Bowie Counties through 800 PM CST... At 719 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ben Lomond to 7 miles southwest of New Boston. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ashdown, Nashville, New Boston, Mineral Springs, Hooks, Wilton, Ben Lomond, Richmond, Leary, Oak Grove, Spring Hill, Arden, Red Bank, Browntown and Pine Prairie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for southwestern Arkansas...and northeastern Texas.
